author: guthl_starkware
content: Is there a min blocksize?

author: lightclient
content: min gas limit is 5000, so the size of an empty block would probably be the min

author: guthl_starkware
content: I guess the likelihood of hitting these size would be rather small.

author: guthl_starkware
content: Thanks

author: lightclient
content: true, but empty blocks themselves are not so uncommon

author: guthl_starkware
content: That's true

author: guthl_starkware
content: Actually, does anyone have a very good explanation for empty blocks?

author: guthl_starkware
content: I mean Eth does not have SPV mining so I don't understand why a miner would compute the state enough to include its block rewards but not work to add txs

author: guthl_starkware
content: Btw, empty blocks are 5000 gas right? Because otherwise, the formula for blockfee might have an issue

author: lightclient
content: no, the gas limit should still be calculated as normal

author: guthl_starkware
content: So, what would be the blockfee computation under a empty block?

author: guthl_starkware
content: Would not we dive by 0?

author: lightclient
content:
this may be a good resource: https://angainor.science/papers/dsn_ethmeasurements.pdf
check out section 3.C.3

author: lightclient
content: base fee?

author: guthl_starkware
content: basefee

author: guthl_starkware
content: Sorry, miswritten it

author: lightclient
content: no, the gas used delta is never a denominator

author: lightclient
content: when the block is empty the `gas_used_delta // parent_gas_target` goes to `1` and we're left with `parent_base_fee // BASE_FEE_MAX_CHANGE_DENOMINATOR` -- this causes the base fee to move down at the maximum rate of ~12.5%

author: guthl_starkware
content: No but the previous block size is.

author: guthl_starkware
content: Sorry nevermind

author: pipermerriam
content: This should probably move to somewhere like <#706868829900505180>

author: guthl_starkware
content: Fair enough, anyway I got the information I needed. Thanks a lot

author: trent_vanepps
content:
as Marius mentioned, we've had several calls with ecosystem members, including gas APIs. EthGasStation has attended a few of them.

see previous call recordings and notes here on the 1559 Cheatsheet:
https://hackmd.io/4YVYKxxvRZGDto7aq7rVkg?view

author: sky.cactus
content: You can compete the empty block and start mining it while you execute transactions to fill the block.  Buys you an extra hundreds of milliseconds of mining I believe.

author: timbeiko
content: <@!619138323776012307> it seems like your questions have been answered, but if not, happy to chat further! right change for this conversation is probably <#692078615269212180> rather than <#706868829900505180>, though üëç

author: guthl_starkware
content:
<@301186049323958275> that‚Äôs a thing. you cannot really. You still need to update your account. So I get why some empty blocks are actually not empty and full the whole space with gas token (account update for block reward + predefined state update for the whole gas token creation)
But I still don‚Äôt get if there are actual empty blocks in Eth like we have in Bitcoin

content:
